author: Ben
message: Will Gwenview get support for displaying raw files like Dolphin, at least those types with integrated jpeg preview (extracted from dcraw -e)? This would be tremendous.

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: For now Gwenview supports whatever Qt supports. So if someone write a raw image plugin for Qt, then Gwenview (and all Qt/KDE applications) will be able to display them.

author: glad
message: I only discovered about DBusMenu now, while reading this post. This is cool!!! Please keep the Plasma look for the menus in the systray. I always found it an aberration that when clicking an icon in Plasma, the widget style for KDE apps is used for the menu that appears instead of the Plasma style.

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message:
For now the Plasma style has been reverted because:
- It was not reviewed by the Oxygen team.
- It introduced more inconsistency: some KDE apps have not been ported to KStatusNotifierItem yet. As a result they would not use the Plasma style, so you end up with one application using Plasma style and the other using widget style.

replies.author: TZ
replies.message: It will be a part KDE SC 4.5?

replies.author: Eol
replies.message: KDE SC 4.5 is out. Is plasma menu a part of it or it was rejected? And if isn't - will it be in KDE SC 4.6?

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: It is not part of it and it was not rejected: it depends on a Qt patch which won't be in before Qt 4.8, so it can't go in KDE SC yet.

replies.author: Kevin Kofler
replies.message: IMHO the real problem is that Plasma is using its own style in the first place instead of matching the rest of KDE.
